1{-# LANGUAGE ScopedTypeVariables #-}
2{-# OPTIONS_GHC -Wall #-}
3
4-- | Convert infixed-operator trees into prefixed-operator trees.
5
6module Koshucode.Baala.Base.Code.Infix
7  ( InfixHeight,
8    infixHeight,
9    infixToPrefix,
10    InfixMapper,
11    InfixConv, InfixAmb, InfixTree,
12  ) where
13
14import qualified Data.Map                          as Map
15import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Overture          as O
16import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Base.Prelude      as B
17import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Base.Code.Tree    as B
18
19
20-- ----------------------  Height function
21
22-- | Direction and height for binary splitting.
23--
24--   [@Left@ /H/] Splits first the left-most operator,
25--   and operator height is /H/.
26--   For example, if the operator @:@ is of @Left 5@,
27--   an expression @(a : b : c)@ is splitted into @(: a (b : c))@
28--   and then @(: a (: b c))@.
29--
30--   [@Right@ /H/] Right-most splitting and height /H/.
31--   For example, if the operator @.@ is of @Right 3@,
32--   an expression @(a . b . c)@ is splitted into @(. (a . b) c)@
33--   and then @(. (. a b) c)@.
34--   An expression @(a . b : c)@ is into @(: (a . b) c)@,
35--   and then @(: (. a b) c)@.
36--   Symbols that is not a binary operator like @b@ are of height 0.
37--   For that reason, heights of expression @(a . b : c)@
38--   are @(0 3 0 5 0)@
39--
40type InfixHeight = Either Int Int
41
42heightOf :: InfixHeight -> Int
43heightOf (Left  ht)  =  ht
44heightOf (Right ht)  =  ht
45
46-- | Make the height function from a height table of operators.
47--
48--   >>> infixHeight Just [('.', Right 3), (':', Right 5)] <$> "1.2:3"
49--   [Left 0, Right 3, Left 0, Right 5, Left 0]
50--
51infixHeight :: (Ord b)
52   => (a -> Maybe b)        -- ^ Connection function
53   -> [(b, InfixHeight)]    -- ^ Height table
54   -> (a -> InfixHeight)    -- ^ Height function
55infixHeight extract htab a = B.fromMaybe (Left 0) ht where
56    hmap = Map.fromList htab
57    ht   = case extract a of
58             Nothing  -> Nothing
59             Just key -> Map.lookup key hmap
60
61
62-- ----------------------  Conversion
63
64{-# WARNING InfixConv, InfixAmb, InfixTree "This is only used in defined module." #-}
65
66-- | Intermediate infix-to-prefix conversion.
67type InfixMapper p a = InfixConv a [InfixTree p a] -> InfixConv a (InfixTree p a)
68
69-- | Infix-to-prefix conversion.
70type InfixConv a tree = tree -> InfixAmb a tree
71
72-- | Code tree or ambiguous infix.
73type InfixAmb a tree = Either [(InfixHeight, a)] tree
74
75-- | Code tree with infix height.
76type InfixTree b a = B.CodeTree' b (InfixHeight, a)
77
78-- | Split branches in a given tree at infixed binary operators.
79infixToPrefix :: forall p a.
80    (O.Map a, O.Map a, O.Map a)       -- ^ Prefix\/infix\/postfix converters.
81     -> (a -> InfixHeight)            -- ^ Height function
82     -> B.Collect (InfixTree p a)     -- ^ Tree grouping function
83     -> InfixMapper p a
84     -> InfixConv a (B.CodeTree' p a) -- ^ Infix-to-prefix conversion.
85infixToPrefix (pre, inf, post) ht group mapper tree =
86    do let tree1 :: InfixTree p a = B.codeTreeFmap' height tree
87       tree2     :: InfixTree p a <- mapper binary tree1
88       Right (B.codeTreeFmap' snd tree2 :: B.CodeTree' p a)
89    where
90      height :: a -> (InfixHeight, a)
91      height x = (ht x, x)
92
93      binary :: InfixConv a [InfixTree p a]
94      binary xs = case infixPos $ map treeHeight xs of
95          Right xi | xi < 0    -> mapper binary `mapM` xs
96                   | otherwise -> move $ splitAt xi xs
97          Left xi              -> Left $ B.untrees $ map (xs !!) xi
98
99      -- move infix operator to front
100      move :: ([InfixTree p a], [InfixTree p a]) -> InfixAmb a [InfixTree p a]
101      move ([], op : right)    = do right' <- binary right
102                                    Right [conv pre op, group right']
103      move (left, op : [])     = do left'  <- binary left
104                                    Right [conv post op, group left']
105      move (left, op : right)  = do left'  <- binary left
106                                    right' <- binary right
107                                    Right [conv inf op, group left', group right']
108      move (_, _)              = error "infixToPrefix"
109
110conv :: O.Map a -> O.Map (InfixTree p a)
111conv = fmap . B.mapSnd
112
113treeHeight :: InfixTree p a -> InfixHeight
114treeHeight (B.TreeL (ht, _))  =  ht
115treeHeight (B.TreeB _ _ _)    =  Left 0
116
117-- | Find index of infix operator.
118infixPos :: [InfixHeight] -> Either [O.Ix] O.Ix
119infixPos = fmap fst . pos (Right (-1, 0)) (Left 0) . zip [0 ..] where
120    pos res _ [] = res
121
122    -- different height
123    -- /res result  /y highest-element  /xi current-index  /xs elements
124    pos res y ((xi, x) : xs)
125        | hy > hx = pos res              y xs  -- remains y
126        | hy < hx = pos (Right (xi, hx)) x xs  -- replaces y to x
127        where  hx = heightOf x
128               hy = heightOf y
129
130    -- same height, same direction
131    pos _     (Right _) ((xi, x@(Right _)) : xs) = pos (Right (xi, 0)) x xs -- replaces y to x
132    pos res y@(Left  _) ((_ ,   (Left  _)) : xs) = pos res y xs             -- remains y
133
134    -- ambiguous: same height, different direction
135    pos (Right (yi, _)) y ((xi, _) : xs)  =  pos (Left [xi, yi])  y xs
136    pos (Left ps)       y ((xi, _) : xs)  =  pos (Left $ xi : ps) y xs
137
